alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 14 at 6:46AM AKDT until March 16 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Heavy Snow Followed by Rain for Northern Panhandle... .Snow arrives to the northern Panhandle late Tuesday night through Thursday. Although this is a high confidence precipitation forecast, there is low confidence in timing of precipitation changing from snow to rain as models continue to struggle resolving multiple low pressure systems in the Gulf and associated plumes of moisture. Precipitation will begin as snow, but the uncertainty revolves around how much moisture will be associated with each surge of energy and on how fast temperatures warm. For now, the current forecast represents the lower end of snow accumulation ranges, but there does exist a less than 20 percent probability that snow accumulations could reach the higher end of the forecast ranges. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches possible. * WHERE...Municipality of Skagway, Haines Borough and Klukwan. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow rates are expected Wednesday night through early Thursday morning before changing to rain.
info.instruction: Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway
